title: Quiz 1: Leadership & Health Systems Organization
description: Assessment on management theories, Kenyan health system levels, and communication dynamics.

questions.question: Match the Management Theory with its primary proponent:
questions.explanation: Taylor focused on scientific workflow, Fayol on administrative principles, Weber on hierarchy/bureaucracy, and Mayo on human relations.
questions.hint: Think about who proposed the '14 Principles of Management'.

questions.question: Which principle of management states that an employee should receive orders from ONE superior only?
questions.explanation: Unity of Command ensures that each employee is accountable to only one supervisor to avoid confusion and conflict.
questions.hint: It prevents conflicting instructions from multiple bosses.

questions.question: Arrange the levels of the Kenyan Health System from the lowest (Community) to the highest (National).
questions.explanation: The system ascends from Community (Level 1) up to National Referral Hospitals (Level 6).

questions.question: Review the comparison table below. Which characteristic correctly identifies a LEADER as opposed to a MANAGER?

richContent.content:
AttributeManagerLeader
FocusSystems/StructurePeople
ApproachAdministersInnovates
ViewShort-rangeLong-range

questions.explanation: Leaders challenge the status quo and do the 'right thing', whereas managers accept the status quo and do 'things right'.
questions.hint: Leaders are associated with change and innovation.

questions.question: Which of the following are identified as psychological barriers to effective communication? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Psychological barriers include self-focus (ego), perception, and cultural bias. Noise and distance are physical barriers.
questions.hint: Look for internal factors within the mind, not physical obstacles.

questions.question: In the context of communication skills, active listening involves three key disciplines: ___BLANK___, ___BLANK___, and Silence.
questions.explanation: The three disciplines for learning to listen better are focus, empathy, and silence.
questions.hint: One involves paying attention, the other involves feeling what they feel.

questions.question: According to the study material, management is considered an art, while leadership is considered a science.
questions.explanation: The material states: 'Management is a science; leadership is an art.'
questions.hint: Which one relies more on soft skills and inspiration?

questions.question: What is the acronym used for setting effective objectives in management (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic, Time-bound)?
questions.explanation: SMART stands for Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Realistic, and Time-bound.
questions.hint: A 5-letter word often used to describe intelligent goals.

questions.question: Based on the text, what is the maximum recommended time for an 'average attention curve' during a public presentation?
questions.explanation: The study material states the average attention curve max is 25 to 40 minutes.
questions.hint: It is less than an hour.

questions.question: Which leadership style is described in the scenario below?

richContent.content: 'Manager John rarely visits the ward. He allows the nursing staff to determine their own shifts, make all decisions regarding patient care protocols, and resolve their own conflicts without his input. He provides minimal direction.'

questions.explanation: Laissez-faire leadership involves minimal direction and giving employees power to make decisions on their own.
